--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...> 
wrote:
> My plan was to only have one member of the faction on Earth 
hunting 
> a specific quarry at any given time to keep things from getting 
too 
> chaotic, but if you want to send me a back story to get around 
this 
> feel free to.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "lordofdarkness11001" 
> <lordofdarkness11001@y...> wrote:
> > me and my friend are thinking about putting some chars into your 
> > faction dewboy.
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > The faction will make it's appearance after I'm out of school 
> for 
> > > the summer.  I get out on the 19th, so look for them on the 
20th 
> or 
> > > later.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> 
> wrote:
> > > > Ok, Azure and I are analizing your ideas :):):)
> > > > 
> > > > By now I suggest that start to introduce your faction (Their 
> > > > arrving, instalation etc.) and we will reply shortly aboutif 
> your 
> > > > chars are very powerful or not.  That's my idea :) do you 
like 
> > > it ? 
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "dewboy30816" 
> <dewboy30816@y...> 
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" 
<airly2002@h...> 
> > > wrote:
> > > > > > Dewboy, could you sent me to my mail your idea for a 
> faction 
> > > or 
> > > > > > could you please repost it in NBW's forums?, I guess 
that 
> due 
> > > > all 
> > > > > > those virus in web we haven't received yet it.
> > > > > 
> > > > > It's on the message board, which apparently hasn't been 
> posted 
> > > on 
> > > > > otherwise since I've left (are you all just too lazy to 
come 
> to 
> > > > the 
> > > > > site and log in?).  Anyway, here it is:
> > > > > 
> > > > > With my school year drawing to a close, I'm considering 
> coming 
> > > > back 
> > > > > for the summer. I have a suggestion though for a new 
faction 
> > > > (please 
> > > > > note, this will for a while at least be a one man 
faction). 
> I 
> > > need 
> > > > > council approval though, and to know how much they can do. 
> Here 
> > > it 
> > > > > is: 
> > > > > 
> > > > > All these being have some ability to predict the future, 
> they 
> > > > > increase this by stealing the "hero/villan potential" from 
> > > various 
> > > > > subjects who had the potential to be heros/villans (also 
> > killing 
> > > > the 
> > > > > subjects, but you have to immobilize them for a few 
> minutes). 
> > > > > 
> > > > > Their leader is named Seer. He supposedly cannot die, but 
he 
> > > never 
> > > > > come to earth so he's a none factor. All his minions are 
> > > required 
> > > > to 
> > > > > give some of their stolen hero/villan potential to him, 
and 
> he 
> > > has 
> > > > > incredible power, he also gives each of his servants a 
> prophesy 
> > > > > telling some detail of their deaths to help delay it. 
> > > > > 
> > > > > The reason they send their minions to earth (only one at a 
> > time, 
> > > > > which is why it's one man, they don't want to do to much 
> > > damage), 
> > > > is 
> > > > > because over millions of years the change caused by 
someone 
> > with 
> > > > > even a small bit of hero/villan potential is incredible, 
so 
> the 
> > > > > potential they can steal is almost limitless. They give 
> their 
> > > > > servants a target before sending them back. 
> > > > > 
> > > > > I haven't thought out all the details, but the first 
minion 
> > > would 
> > > > be 
> > > > > named Fortuneteller (a female), and her prophesy would be: 
> > > > > 
> > > > > So long as you pay the Seer's price, no Transmetal will 
take 
> > > your 
> > > > > life (so long as you give Seer his fair share of the 
> potential 
> > > you 
> > > > > steal no transmetal will kill you). 
> > > > > 
> > > > > He also has a council of three other powerful members of 
his 
> > > > > faction, who will die, but share a prophecy of their 
death: 
> > > > > 
> > > > > One will die by fire, one by ice, and the last must perish 
> > > thrice 
> > > > > (essentially one will die, but his/her spark will return 
to 
> > Seer 
> > > > for 
> > > > > a new body, after which one will die by fire, then the 
first 
> > > will 
> > > > > die again, but the same thing will happen, then one will 
die 
> by 
> > > > ice, 
> > > > > then the first will die and stay dead, but they don't know 
> > which 
> > > > is 
> > > > > which and won't chance it putting themselves in danger). 
> > > > > 
> > > > > So I want to know how much prescience I'm allowed? How can 
> that 
> > > > > effect the game? And is it o.k. to dictate how my 
characters 
> > can 
> > > > die 
> > > > > (they can still have the crap beaten out of them, but they 
> > can't 
> > > > be 
> > > > > destroyed any other way).
> > > > > 
> > > > > 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > >
